item.description:
If you are interested in practicing your snowshoeing next weekend Mount Monadnock should have good conditions. Due to the need for good fresh snow, I'll call the headquarters Thursday to see if conditions are good or not and make the decision to go ahead.

YOU NEED TO BRING THE RIGHT GEAR.
Please make sure you have good wicking layers and a good waterproof outer layer, gloves, poles, waterproof boots, some food/snacks, water, and of course snow shoes.
You can rent snowshoes at REI in Cranston if you do not have your own.

We'll meet at the state offices parking lot in Providence at 8am to aim to be at the park by 10:30/11:00. When we meet we will do a gear check to make sure we have everything.
When we check in at shop at the headquarters on Poole Road they can provide detailed maps and recommendations of trails in good shape.

The web sites for the park and maps is:
http://www.nhparks.st...
map:
http://www.nhstatepar...

I'm not planning trying for the summit, this is just an opportunity for us to practice and get comfortable before we get too adventurous.

It should not be necessary to do an overnight, it is 2 1/2 hrs there from Providence.

NO PETS are allowed in the park.

The entry fee is $4 per person.

Ian.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Blue Trailblazer and a guy with long hair.
item.name: Mount Monadnock Snowshoeing
